00045 #define D_MOUNT (D_SUPER|D_CONFIG/*|D_WARNING */)

00061 /**************** config llog ********************/
00062 
00075 int lustre_process_log(struct super_block *sb, char *logname,
00076                      struct config_llog_instance *cfg)
00077 {
00078         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00079         struct lustre_cfg_bufs *bufs;
00080         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
00081         struct obd_device *mgc = lsi->lsi_mgc;
00082         int rc;
00083         ENTRY;
00084 
00085         LASSERT(mgc);
00086         LASSERT(cfg);
00087 
00088         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(bufs);
00089         if (bufs == NULL)
00090                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00091 
00092         /* mgc_process_config */
00093         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(bufs, mgc->obd_name);
00094         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 1, logname);
00095         lustre_cfg_bufs_set(bufs, 2, cfg, sizeof(*cfg));
00096         lustre_cfg_bufs_set(bufs, 3, &sb, sizeof(sb));
00097         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_LOG_START, bufs);
00098         if (lcfg == NULL)
00099                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00100         rc = obd_process_config(mgc, sizeof(*lcfg), lcfg);
00101         lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00102 out:
00103         OBD_FREE_PTR(bufs);
00104 
00105         if (rc == -EINVAL)
00106                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x15b, "%s: The configuration from log '%s'"
00107                                    "failed from the MGS (%d).  Make sure this "
00108                                    "client and the MGS are running compatible "
00109                                    "versions of Lustre.\n",
00110                                    mgc->obd_name, logname, rc);
00111         else if (rc != 0)
00112                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x15c, "%s: The configuration from log '%s' "
00113                                    "failed (%d). This may be the result of "
00114                                    "communication errors between this node and "
00115                                    "the MGS, a bad configuration, or other "
00116                                    "errors. See the syslog for more "
00117                                    "information.\n", mgc->obd_name, logname,
00118                                    rc);
00119 
00120         /* class_obd_list(); */
00121         RETURN(rc);
00122 }
00123 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_process_log);
00124 
00125 /* Stop watching this config log for updates */
00126 int lustre_end_log(struct super_block *sb, char *logname,
00127                        struct config_llog_instance *cfg)
00128 {
00129         struct lustre_cfg *lcfg;
00130         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
00131         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
00132         struct obd_device *mgc = lsi->lsi_mgc;
00133         int rc;
00134         ENTRY;
00135 
00136         if (!mgc)
00137                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00138 
00139         /* mgc_process_config */
00140         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, mgc->obd_name);
00141         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, logname);
00142         if (cfg)
00143                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set(&bufs, 2, cfg, sizeof(*cfg));
00144         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_LOG_END, &bufs);
00145         if (lcfg == NULL)
00146                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00147         rc = obd_process_config(mgc, sizeof(*lcfg), lcfg);
00148         lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00149         RETURN(rc);
00150 }
00151 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_end_log);
00152 
00153 /**************** obd start *******************/
00154 
00158 int do_lcfg(char *cfgname, lnet_nid_t nid, int cmd,
00159             char *s1, char *s2, char *s3, char *s4)
00160 {
00161         struct lustre_cfg_bufs bufs;
00162         struct lustre_cfg    * lcfg = NULL;
00163         int rc;
00164 
00165         CDEBUG(D_TRACE, "lcfg %s %#x %s %s %s %s\n", cfgname,
00166                cmd, s1, s2, s3, s4);
00167 
00168         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, cfgname);
00169         if (s1)
00170                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, s1);
00171         if (s2)
00172                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 2, s2);
00173         if (s3)
00174                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 3, s3);
00175         if (s4)
00176                 lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 4, s4);
00177 
00178         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(cmd, &bufs);
00179         if (lcfg == NULL)
00180                 return -ENOMEM;
00181         lcfg->lcfg_nid = nid;
00182         rc = class_process_config(lcfg);
00183         lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00184         return(rc);
00185 }
00186 
00190 int lustre_start_simple(char *obdname, char *type, char *uuid,
00191                         char *s1, char *s2, char *s3, char *s4)
00192 {
00193         int rc;
00194         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "Starting obd %s (typ=%s)\n", obdname, type);
00195 
00196         rc = do_lcfg(obdname, 0, LCFG_ATTACH, type, uuid, NULL, NULL);
00197         if (rc) {
00198                 CERROR("%s attach error %d\n", obdname, rc);
00199                 return rc;
00200         }
00201         rc = do_lcfg(obdname, 0, LCFG_SETUP, s1, s2, s3, s4);
00202         if (rc) {
00203                 CERROR("%s setup error %d\n", obdname, rc);
00204                 do_lcfg(obdname, 0, LCFG_DETACH, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00205         }
00206         return rc;
00207 }
00208 
00209 static DEFINE_MUTEX(mgc_start_lock);
00210 
00217 int lustre_start_mgc(struct super_block *sb)
00218 {
00219         struct obd_connect_data *data = NULL;
00220         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
00221         struct obd_device *obd;
00222         struct obd_export *exp;
00223         struct obd_uuid *uuid;
00224         class_uuid_t uuidc;
00225         lnet_nid_t nid;
00226         char nidstr[LNET_NIDSTR_SIZE];
00227         char *mgcname = NULL, *niduuid = NULL, *mgssec = NULL;
00228         char *ptr;
00229         int rc = 0, i = 0, j;
00230         size_t len;
00231         ENTRY;
00232 
00233         LASSERT(lsi->lsi_lmd);
00234 
00235         /* Find the first non-lo MGS nid for our MGC name */
00236         if (IS_SERVER(lsi)) {
00237                 /* mount -o mgsnode=nid */
00238                 ptr = lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgs;
00239                 if (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgs &&
00240                     (class_parse_nid(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgs, &nid, &ptr) == 0)) {
00241                         i++;
00242                 } else if (IS_MGS(lsi)) {
00243                         lnet_process_id_t id;
00244                         while ((rc = LNetGetId(i++, &id)) != -ENOENT) {
00245                                 if (LNET_NETTYP(LNET_NIDNET(id.nid)) == LOLND)
00246                                         continue;
00247                                 nid = id.nid;
00248                                 i++;
00249                                 break;
00250                         }
00251                 }
00252         } else { /* client */
00253                 /* Use nids from mount line: uml1,1@elan:uml2,2@elan:/lustre */
00254                 ptr = lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_dev;
00255                 if (class_parse_nid(ptr, &nid, &ptr) == 0)
00256                         i++;
00257         }
00258         if (i == 0) {
00259                 CERROR("No valid MGS nids found.\n");
00260                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00261         }
00262 
00263         mutex_lock(&mgc_start_lock);
00264 
00265         libcfs_nid2str_r(nid, nidstr, sizeof(nidstr));
00266         len = strlen(LUSTRE_MGC_OBDNAME) + strlen(nidstr) + 1;
00267         OBD_ALLOC(mgcname, len);
00268         OBD_ALLOC(niduuid, len + 2);
00269         if (mgcname == NULL || niduuid == NULL)
00270                 GOTO(out_free, rc = -ENOMEM);
00271         snprintf(mgcname, len, "%s%s", LUSTRE_MGC_OBDNAME, nidstr);
00272 
00273         mgssec = lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgssec ? lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgssec : "";
00274 
00275         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(data);
00276         if (data == NULL)
00277                 GOTO(out_free, rc = -ENOMEM);
00278 
00279         obd = class_name2obd(mgcname);
00280         if (obd && !obd->obd_stopping) {
00281                 int recov_bk;
00282 
00283                 rc = obd_set_info_async(NULL, obd->obd_self_export,
00284                                         strlen(KEY_MGSSEC), KEY_MGSSEC,
00285                                         strlen(mgssec), mgssec, NULL);
00286                 if (rc)
00287                         GOTO(out_free, rc);
00288 
00289                 /* Re-using an existing MGC */
00290                 atomic_inc(&obd->u.cli.cl_mgc_refcount);
00291 
00292                 /* IR compatibility check, only for clients */
00293                 if (lmd_is_client(lsi->lsi_lmd)) {
00294                         int has_ir;
00295                         int vallen = sizeof(*data);
00296                         __u32 *flags = &lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags;
00297 
00298                         rc = obd_get_info(NULL, obd->obd_self_export,
00299                                           strlen(KEY_CONN_DATA), KEY_CONN_DATA,
00300                                           &vallen, data);
00301                         LASSERT(rc == 0);
00302                         has_ir = OCD_HAS_FLAG(data, IMP_RECOV);
00303                         if (has_ir ^ !(*flags & LMD_FLG_NOIR)) {
00304                                 /* LMD_FLG_NOIR is for test purpose only */
00305                                 LCONSOLE_WARN(
00306                                     "Trying to mount a client with IR setting "
00307                                     "not compatible with current mgc. "
00308                                     "Force to use current mgc setting that is "
00309                                     "IR %s.\n",
00310                                     has_ir ? "enabled" : "disabled");
00311                                 if (has_ir)
00312                                         *flags &= ~LMD_FLG_NOIR;
00313                                 else
00314                                         *flags |= LMD_FLG_NOIR;
00315                         }
00316                 }
00317 
00318                 recov_bk = 0;
00319                 /* If we are restarting the MGS, don't try to keep the MGC's
00320                    old connection, or registration will fail. */
00321                 if (IS_MGS(lsi)) {
00322                         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "New MGS with live MGC\n");
00323                         recov_bk = 1;
00324                 }
00325 
00326                 /* Try all connections, but only once (again).
00327                    We don't want to block another target from starting
00328                    (using its local copy of the log), but we do want to connect
00329                    if at all possible. */
00330                 recov_bk++;
00331                 CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "%s: Set MGC reconnect %d\n", mgcname,recov_bk);
00332                 rc = obd_set_info_async(NULL, obd->obd_self_export,
00333                                         sizeof(KEY_INIT_RECOV_BACKUP),
00334                                         KEY_INIT_RECOV_BACKUP,
00335                                         sizeof(recov_bk), &recov_bk, NULL);
00336                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00337         }
00338 
00339         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "Start MGC '%s'\n", mgcname);
00340 
00341         /* Add the primary nids for the MGS */
00342         i = 0;
00343         snprintf(niduuid, len + 2, "%s_%x", mgcname, i);
00344         if (IS_SERVER(lsi)) {
00345                 ptr = lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgs;
00346                 CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "mgs nids %s.\n", ptr);
00347                 if (IS_MGS(lsi)) {
00348                         /* Use local nids (including LO) */
00349                         lnet_process_id_t id;
00350                         while ((rc = LNetGetId(i++, &id)) != -ENOENT) {
00351                                 rc = do_lcfg(mgcname, id.nid, LCFG_ADD_UUID,
00352                                              niduuid, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00353                         }
00354                 } else {
00355                         /* Use mgsnode= nids */
00356                         /* mount -o mgsnode=nid */
00357                         if (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgs) {
00358                                 ptr = lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgs;
00359                         } else if (class_find_param(ptr, PARAM_MGSNODE,
00360                                                     &ptr) != 0) {
00361                                 CERROR("No MGS nids given.\n");
00362                                 GOTO(out_free, rc = -EINVAL);
00363                         }
00364                         /*
00365                          * LU-3829.
00366                          * Here we only take the first mgsnid as its primary
00367                          * serving mgs node, the rest mgsnid will be taken as
00368                          * failover mgs node, otherwise they would be takens
00369                          * as multiple nids of a single mgs node.
00370                          */
00371                         while (class_parse_nid(ptr, &nid, &ptr) == 0) {
00372                                 rc = do_lcfg(mgcname, nid, LCFG_ADD_UUID,
00373                                              niduuid, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00374                                 if (rc == 0) {
00375                                         i = 1;
00376                                         break;
00377                                 }
00378                         }
00379                 }
00380         } else { /* client */
00381                 /* Use nids from mount line: uml1,1@elan:uml2,2@elan:/lustre */
00382                 ptr = lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_dev;
00383                 while (class_parse_nid(ptr, &nid, &ptr) == 0) {
00384                         rc = do_lcfg(mgcname, nid, LCFG_ADD_UUID,
00385                                      niduuid, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00386                         if (rc == 0)
00387                                 ++i;
00388                         /* Stop at the first failover nid */
00389                         if (*ptr == ':')
00390                                 break;
00391                 }
00392         }
00393         if (i == 0) {
00394                 CERROR("No valid MGS nids found.\n");
00395                 GOTO(out_free, rc = -EINVAL);
00396         }
00397         lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgs_failnodes = 1;
00398 
00399         /* Random uuid for MGC allows easier reconnects */
00400         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(uuid);
00401         ll_generate_random_uuid(uuidc);
00402         class_uuid_unparse(uuidc, uuid);
00403 
00404         /* Start the MGC */
00405         rc = lustre_start_simple(mgcname, LUSTRE_MGC_NAME,
00406                                  (char *)uuid->uuid, LUSTRE_MGS_OBDNAME,
00407                                  niduuid, NULL, NULL);
00408         OBD_FREE_PTR(uuid);
00409         if (rc)
00410                 GOTO(out_free, rc);
00411 
00412         /* Add any failover MGS nids */
00413         i = 1;
00414         while (ptr && ((*ptr == ':' ||
00415                class_find_param(ptr, PARAM_MGSNODE, &ptr) == 0))) {
00416                 /* New failover node */
00417                 sprintf(niduuid, "%s_%x", mgcname, i);
00418                 j = 0;
00419                 while (class_parse_nid_quiet(ptr, &nid, &ptr) == 0) {
00420                         rc = do_lcfg(mgcname, nid, LCFG_ADD_UUID,
00421                                      niduuid, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00422                         if (rc == 0)
00423                                 ++j;
00424                         if (*ptr == ':')
00425                                 break;
00426                 }
00427                 if (j > 0) {
00428                         rc = do_lcfg(mgcname, 0, LCFG_ADD_CONN,
00429                                      niduuid, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00430                         if (rc == 0)
00431                                 ++i;
00432                 } else {
00433                         /* at ":/fsname" */
00434                         break;
00435                 }
00436         }
00437         lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgs_failnodes = i;
00438 
00439         obd = class_name2obd(mgcname);
00440         if (!obd) {
00441                 CERROR("Can't find mgcobd %s\n", mgcname);
00442                 GOTO(out_free, rc = -ENOTCONN);
00443         }
00444 
00445         rc = obd_set_info_async(NULL, obd->obd_self_export,
00446                                 strlen(KEY_MGSSEC), KEY_MGSSEC,
00447                                 strlen(mgssec), mgssec, NULL);
00448         if (rc)
00449                 GOTO(out_free, rc);
00450 
00451         /* Keep a refcount of servers/clients who started with "mount",
00452            so we know when we can get rid of the mgc. */
00453         atomic_set(&obd->u.cli.cl_mgc_refcount, 1);
00454 
00455         /* We connect to the MGS at setup, and don't disconnect until cleanup */
00456         data->ocd_connect_flags = OBD_CONNECT_VERSION | OBD_CONNECT_AT |
00457                                   OBD_CONNECT_FULL20 | OBD_CONNECT_IMP_RECOV |
00458                                   OBD_CONNECT_LVB_TYPE | OBD_CONNECT_BULK_MBITS;
00459 
00460 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(3, 0, 53, 0)
00461         data->ocd_connect_flags |= OBD_CONNECT_MNE_SWAB;
00462 #endif
00463 
00464         if (lmd_is_client(lsi->lsi_lmd) &&
00465             lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_NOIR)
00466                 data->ocd_connect_flags &= ~OBD_CONNECT_IMP_RECOV;
00467         data->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
00468         rc = obd_connect(NULL, &exp, obd, &(obd->obd_uuid), data, NULL);
00469         if (rc) {
00470                 CERROR("connect failed %d\n", rc);
00471                 GOTO(out, rc);
00472         }
00473 
00474         obd->u.cli.cl_mgc_mgsexp = exp;
00475 
00476 out:
00477         /* Keep the mgc info in the sb. Note that many lsi's can point
00478            to the same mgc.*/
00479         lsi->lsi_mgc = obd;
00480 out_free:
00481         mutex_unlock(&mgc_start_lock);
00482 
00483         if (data)
00484                 OBD_FREE_PTR(data);
00485         if (mgcname)
00486                 OBD_FREE(mgcname, len);
00487         if (niduuid)
00488                 OBD_FREE(niduuid, len + 2);
00489         RETURN(rc);
00490 }
00491 
00492 static int lustre_stop_mgc(struct super_block *sb)
00493 {
00494         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
00495         struct obd_device *obd;
00496         char *niduuid = NULL, *ptr = NULL;
00497         int i, rc = 0, len = 0;
00498         ENTRY;
00499 
00500         if (!lsi)
00501                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00502         obd = lsi->lsi_mgc;
00503         if (!obd)
00504                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00505         lsi->lsi_mgc = NULL;
00506 
00507         mutex_lock(&mgc_start_lock);
00508         LASSERT(atomic_read(&obd->u.cli.cl_mgc_refcount) > 0);
00509         if (!atomic_dec_and_test(&obd->u.cli.cl_mgc_refcount)) {
00510                 /* This is not fatal, every client that stops
00511                    will call in here. */
00512                 CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "mgc still has %d references.\n",
00513                        atomic_read(&obd->u.cli.cl_mgc_refcount));
00514                 GOTO(out, rc = -EBUSY);
00515         }
00516 
00517         /* The MGC has no recoverable data in any case.
00518          * force shotdown set in umount_begin */
00519         obd->obd_no_recov = 1;
00520 
00521         if (obd->u.cli.cl_mgc_mgsexp) {
00522                 /* An error is not fatal, if we are unable to send the
00523                    disconnect mgs ping evictor cleans up the export */
00524                 rc = obd_disconnect(obd->u.cli.cl_mgc_mgsexp);
00525                 if (rc)
00526                         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "disconnect failed %d\n", rc);
00527         }
00528 
00529         /* Save the obdname for cleaning the nid uuids, which are
00530            obdname_XX */
00531         len = strlen(obd->obd_name) + 6;
00532         OBD_ALLOC(niduuid, len);
00533         if (niduuid) {
00534                 strcpy(niduuid, obd->obd_name);
00535                 ptr = niduuid + strlen(niduuid);
00536         }
00537 
00538         rc = class_manual_cleanup(obd);
00539         if (rc)
00540                 GOTO(out, rc);
00541 
00542         /* Clean the nid uuids */
00543         if (!niduuid)
00544                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00545 
00546         for (i = 0; i < lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgs_failnodes; i++) {
00547                 sprintf(ptr, "_%x", i);
00548                 rc = do_lcfg(LUSTRE_MGC_OBDNAME, 0, LCFG_DEL_UUID,
00549                              niduuid, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00550                 if (rc)
00551                         CERROR("del MDC UUID %s failed: rc = %d\n",
00552                                niduuid, rc);
00553         }
00554 out:
00555         if (niduuid)
00556                 OBD_FREE(niduuid, len);
00557 
00558         /* class_import_put will get rid of the additional connections */
00559         mutex_unlock(&mgc_start_lock);
00560         RETURN(rc);
00561 }
00562 
00563 /***************** lustre superblock **************/
00564 
00565 static struct lustre_sb_info *lustre_init_lsi(struct super_block *sb)
00566 {
00567         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi;
00568         ENTRY;
00569 
00570         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(lsi);
00571         if (!lsi)
00572                 RETURN(NULL);
00573         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(lsi->lsi_lmd);
00574         if (!lsi->lsi_lmd) {
00575                 OBD_FREE_PTR(lsi);
00576                 RETURN(NULL);
00577         }
00578 
00579         lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_exclude_count = 0;
00580         lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_recovery_time_soft = 0;
00581         lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_recovery_time_hard = 0;
00582         s2lsi_nocast(sb) = lsi;
00583         /* we take 1 extra ref for our setup */
00584         atomic_set(&lsi->lsi_mounts, 1);
00585 
00586         /* Default umount style */
00587         lsi->lsi_flags = LSI_UMOUNT_FAILOVER;
00588         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lsi->lsi_lwp_list);
00589         spin_lock_init(&lsi->lsi_lwp_lock);
00590 
00591         RETURN(lsi);
00592 }
00593 
00594 static int lustre_free_lsi(struct super_block *sb)
00595 {
00596         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
00597         ENTRY;
00598 
00599         LASSERT(lsi != NULL);
00600         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "Freeing lsi %p\n", lsi);
00601 
00602         /* someone didn't call server_put_mount. */
00603         LASSERT(atomic_read(&lsi->lsi_mounts) == 0);
00604 
00605         if (lsi->lsi_lmd != NULL) {
00606                 if (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_dev != NULL)
00607                         OBD_FREE(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_dev,
00608                                 strlen(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_dev) + 1);
00609                 if (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_profile != NULL)
00610                         OBD_FREE(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_profile,
00611                                 strlen(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_profile) + 1);
00612                 if (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_fileset != NULL)
00613                         OBD_FREE(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_fileset,
00614                                 strlen(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_fileset) + 1);
00615                 if (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgssec != NULL)
00616                         OBD_FREE(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgssec,
00617                                 strlen(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgssec) + 1);
00618                 if (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_opts != NULL)
00619                         OBD_FREE(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_opts,
00620                                 strlen(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_opts) + 1);
00621                 if (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_exclude_count)
00622                         OBD_FREE(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_exclude,
00623                                 sizeof(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_exclude[0]) *
00624                                 lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_exclude_count);
00625                 if (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgs != NULL)
00626                         OBD_FREE(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgs,
00627                                  strlen(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_mgs) + 1);
00628                 if (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_osd_type != NULL)
00629                         OBD_FREE(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_osd_type,
00630                                  strlen(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_osd_type) + 1);
00631                 if (lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_params != NULL)
00632                         OBD_FREE(lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_params, 4096);
00633 
00634                 OBD_FREE_PTR(lsi->lsi_lmd);
00635         }
00636 
00637         LASSERT(lsi->lsi_llsbi == NULL);
00638         OBD_FREE_PTR(lsi);
00639         s2lsi_nocast(sb) = NULL;
00640 
00641         RETURN(0);
00642 }
00643 
00644 /* The lsi has one reference for every server that is using the disk -
00645    e.g. MDT, MGS, and potentially MGC */
00646 int lustre_put_lsi(struct super_block *sb)
00647 {
00648         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
00649         ENTRY;
00650 
00651         LASSERT(lsi != NULL);
00652 
00653         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "put %p %d\n", sb, atomic_read(&lsi->lsi_mounts));
00654         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&lsi->lsi_mounts)) {
00655                 if (IS_SERVER(lsi) && lsi->lsi_osd_exp) {
00656                         lu_device_put(&lsi->lsi_dt_dev->dd_lu_dev);
00657                         lsi->lsi_osd_exp->exp_obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt.dt = NULL;
00658                         lsi->lsi_dt_dev = NULL;
00659                         obd_disconnect(lsi->lsi_osd_exp);
00660                         /* wait till OSD is gone */
00661                         obd_zombie_barrier();
00662                 }
00663                 lustre_free_lsi(sb);
00664                 RETURN(1);
00665         }
00666         RETURN(0);
00667 }
00668 
00669 /*** SERVER NAME ***
00670  * <FSNAME><SEPARATOR><TYPE><INDEX>
00671  * FSNAME is between 1 and 8 characters (inclusive).
00672  *      Excluded characters are '/' and ':'
00673  * SEPARATOR is either ':' or '-'
00674  * TYPE: "OST", "MDT", etc.
00675  * INDEX: Hex representation of the index
00676  */
00677 
00685 int server_name2fsname(const char *svname, char *fsname, const char **endptr)
00686 {
00687         const char *dash;
00688 
00689         dash = svname + strnlen(svname, 8); /* max fsname length is 8 */
00690         for (; dash > svname && *dash != '-' && *dash != ':'; dash--)
00691                 ;
00692         if (dash == svname)
00693                 return -EINVAL;
00694 
00695         if (fsname != NULL) {
00696                 strncpy(fsname, svname, dash - svname);
00697                 fsname[dash - svname] = '\0';
00698         }
00699 
00700         if (endptr != NULL)
00701                 *endptr = dash;
00702 
00703         return 0;
00704 }
00705 EXPORT_SYMBOL(server_name2fsname);
00706 
00712 int server_name2svname(const char *label, char *svname, const char **endptr,
00713                        size_t svsize)
00714 {
00715         int rc;
00716         const char *dash;
00717 
00718         /* We use server_name2fsname() just for parsing */
00719         rc = server_name2fsname(label, NULL, &dash);
00720         if (rc != 0)
00721                 return rc;
00722 
00723         if (endptr != NULL)
00724                 *endptr = dash;
00725 
00726         if (strlcpy(svname, dash + 1, svsize) >= svsize)
00727                 return -E2BIG;
00728 
00729         return 0;
00730 }
00731 EXPORT_SYMBOL(server_name2svname);
00732 
00736 int server_name_is_ost(const char *svname)
00737 {
00738         const char *dash;
00739         int rc;
00740 
00741         /* We use server_name2fsname() just for parsing */
00742         rc = server_name2fsname(svname, NULL, &dash);
00743         if (rc != 0)
00744                 return rc;
00745 
00746         dash++;
00747 
00748         if (strncmp(dash, "OST", 3) == 0)
00749                 return 1;
00750         return 0;
00751 }
00752 EXPORT_SYMBOL(server_name_is_ost);
00753 
00758 int target_name2index(const char *tgtname, __u32 *idx, const char **endptr)
00759 {
00760         const char *dash = tgtname;
00761         unsigned long index;
00762         int rc;
00763 
00764         if (strncmp(dash, "MDT", 3) == 0)
00765                 rc = LDD_F_SV_TYPE_MDT;
00766         else if (strncmp(dash, "OST", 3) == 0)
00767                 rc = LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST;
00768         else
00769                 return -EINVAL;
00770 
00771         dash += 3;
00772 
00773         if (strncmp(dash, "all", 3) == 0) {
00774                 if (endptr != NULL)
00775                         *endptr = dash + 3;
00776                 return rc | LDD_F_SV_ALL;
00777         }
00778 
00779         index = simple_strtoul(dash, (char **)endptr, 16);
00780         if (idx != NULL)
00781                 *idx = index;
00782         return rc;
00783 }
00784 EXPORT_SYMBOL(target_name2index);
00785 
00786 /* Get the index from the obd name.
00787    rc = server type, or
00788    rc < 0  on error
00789    if endptr isn't NULL it is set to end of name */
00790 int server_name2index(const char *svname, __u32 *idx, const char **endptr)
00791 {
00792         const char *dash;
00793         int rc;
00794 
00795         /* We use server_name2fsname() just for parsing */
00796         rc = server_name2fsname(svname, NULL, &dash);
00797         if (rc != 0)
00798                 return rc;
00799 
00800         dash++;
00801         rc = target_name2index(dash, idx, endptr);
00802         if (rc < 0)
00803                 return rc;
00804 
00805         /* Account for -mdc after index that is possible when specifying mdt */
00806         if (endptr != NULL && strncmp(LUSTRE_MDC_NAME, *endptr + 1,
00807                                       sizeof(LUSTRE_MDC_NAME)-1) == 0)
00808                 *endptr += sizeof(LUSTRE_MDC_NAME);
00809 
00810         return rc;
00811 }
00812 EXPORT_SYMBOL(server_name2index);
00813 
00814 /*************** mount common betweeen server and client ***************/
00815 
00816 /* Common umount */
00817 int lustre_common_put_super(struct super_block *sb)
00818 {
00819         int rc;
00820         ENTRY;
00821 
00822         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "dropping sb %p\n", sb);
00823 
00824         /* Drop a ref to the MGC */
00825         rc = lustre_stop_mgc(sb);
00826         if (rc && (rc != -ENOENT)) {
00827                 if (rc != -EBUSY) {
00828                         CERROR("Can't stop MGC: %d\n", rc);
00829                         RETURN(rc);
00830                 }
00831                 /* BUSY just means that there's some other obd that
00832                    needs the mgc.  Let him clean it up. */
00833                 CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "MGC still in use\n");
00834         }
00835         /* Drop a ref to the mounted disk */
00836         lustre_put_lsi(sb);
00837 
00838         RETURN(rc);
00839 }
00840 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_common_put_super);
00841 
00842 static void lmd_print(struct lustre_mount_data *lmd)
00843 {
00844         int i;
00845 
00846         PRINT_CMD(D_MOUNT, "  mount data:\n");
00847         if (lmd_is_client(lmd))
00848                 PRINT_CMD(D_MOUNT, "profile: %s\n", lmd->lmd_profile);
00849         PRINT_CMD(D_MOUNT, "device:  %s\n", lmd->lmd_dev);
00850         PRINT_CMD(D_MOUNT, "flags:   %x\n", lmd->lmd_flags);
00851 
00852         if (lmd->lmd_opts)
00853                 PRINT_CMD(D_MOUNT, "options: %s\n", lmd->lmd_opts);
00854 
00855         if (lmd->lmd_recovery_time_soft)
00856                 PRINT_CMD(D_MOUNT, "recovery time soft: %d\n",
00857                           lmd->lmd_recovery_time_soft);
00858 
00859         if (lmd->lmd_recovery_time_hard)
00860                 PRINT_CMD(D_MOUNT, "recovery time hard: %d\n",
00861                           lmd->lmd_recovery_time_hard);
00862 
00863         for (i = 0; i < lmd->lmd_exclude_count; i++) {
00864                 PRINT_CMD(D_MOUNT, "exclude %d:  OST%04x\n", i,
00865                           lmd->lmd_exclude[i]);
00866         }
00867 }
00868 
00869 /* Is this server on the exclusion list */
00870 int lustre_check_exclusion(struct super_block *sb, char *svname)
00871 {
00872         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
00873         struct lustre_mount_data *lmd = lsi->lsi_lmd;
00874         __u32 index;
00875         int i, rc;
00876         ENTRY;
00877 
00878         rc = server_name2index(svname, &index, NULL);
00879         if (rc != LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST)
00880                 /* Only exclude OSTs */
00881                 RETURN(0);
00882 
00883         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "Check exclusion %s (%d) in %d of %s\n", svname,
00884                index, lmd->lmd_exclude_count, lmd->lmd_dev);
00885 
00886         for(i = 0; i < lmd->lmd_exclude_count; i++) {
00887                 if (index == lmd->lmd_exclude[i]) {
00888                         CWARN("Excluding %s (on exclusion list)\n", svname);
00889                         RETURN(1);
00890                 }
00891         }
00892         RETURN(0);
00893 }
00894 
00895 /* mount -v  -o exclude=lustre-OST0001:lustre-OST0002 -t lustre ... */
00896 static int lmd_make_exclusion(struct lustre_mount_data *lmd, const char *ptr)
00897 {
00898         const char *s1 = ptr, *s2;
00899         __u32 *exclude_list;
00900         __u32 index = 0;
00901         int rc = 0, devmax;
00902         ENTRY;
00903 
00904         /* The shortest an ost name can be is 8 chars: -OST0000.
00905            We don't actually know the fsname at this time, so in fact
00906            a user could specify any fsname. */
00907         devmax = strlen(ptr) / 8 + 1;
00908 
00909         /* temp storage until we figure out how many we have */
00910         OBD_ALLOC(exclude_list, sizeof(index) * devmax);
00911         if (!exclude_list)
00912                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00913 
00914         /* we enter this fn pointing at the '=' */
00915         while (*s1 && *s1 != ' ' && *s1 != ',') {
00916                 s1++;
00917                 rc = server_name2index(s1, &index, &s2);
00918                 if (rc < 0) {
00919                         CERROR("Can't parse server name '%s': rc = %d\n",
00920                                s1, rc);
00921                         break;
00922                 }
00923                 if (rc == LDD_F_SV_TYPE_OST)
00924                         exclude_list[lmd->lmd_exclude_count++] = index;
00925                 else
00926                         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "ignoring exclude %.*s: type = %#x\n",
00927                                (uint)(s2-s1), s1, rc);
00928                 s1 = s2;
00929                 /* now we are pointing at ':' (next exclude)
00930                    or ',' (end of excludes) */
00931                 if (lmd->lmd_exclude_count >= devmax)
00932                         break;
00933         }
00934         if (rc >= 0) /* non-err */
00935                 rc = 0;
00936 
00937         if (lmd->lmd_exclude_count) {
00938                 /* permanent, freed in lustre_free_lsi */
00939                 OBD_ALLOC(lmd->lmd_exclude, sizeof(index) *
00940                           lmd->lmd_exclude_count);
00941                 if (lmd->lmd_exclude) {
00942                         memcpy(lmd->lmd_exclude, exclude_list,
00943                                sizeof(index) * lmd->lmd_exclude_count);
00944                 } else {
00945                         rc = -ENOMEM;
00946                         lmd->lmd_exclude_count = 0;
00947                 }
00948         }
00949         OBD_FREE(exclude_list, sizeof(index) * devmax);
00950         RETURN(rc);
00951 }
00952 
00953 static int lmd_parse_mgssec(struct lustre_mount_data *lmd, char *ptr)
00954 {
00955         char   *tail;
00956         int     length;
00957 
00958         if (lmd->lmd_mgssec != NULL) {
00959                 OBD_FREE(lmd->lmd_mgssec, strlen(lmd->lmd_mgssec) + 1);
00960                 lmd->lmd_mgssec = NULL;
00961         }
00962 
00963         tail = strchr(ptr, ',');
00964         if (tail == NULL)
00965                 length = strlen(ptr);
00966         else
00967                 length = tail - ptr;
00968 
00969         OBD_ALLOC(lmd->lmd_mgssec, length + 1);
00970         if (lmd->lmd_mgssec == NULL)
00971                 return -ENOMEM;
00972 
00973         memcpy(lmd->lmd_mgssec, ptr, length);
00974         lmd->lmd_mgssec[length] = '\0';
00975         return 0;
00976 }
00977 
00978 static int lmd_parse_string(char **handle, char *ptr)
00979 {
00980         char   *tail;
00981         int     length;
00982 
00983         if ((handle == NULL) || (ptr == NULL))
00984                 return -EINVAL;
00985 
00986         if (*handle != NULL) {
00987                 OBD_FREE(*handle, strlen(*handle) + 1);
00988                 *handle = NULL;
00989         }
00990 
00991         tail = strchr(ptr, ',');
00992         if (tail == NULL)
00993                 length = strlen(ptr);
00994         else
00995                 length = tail - ptr;
00996 
00997         OBD_ALLOC(*handle, length + 1);
00998         if (*handle == NULL)
00999                 return -ENOMEM;
01000 
01001         memcpy(*handle, ptr, length);
01002         (*handle)[length] = '\0';
01003 
01004         return 0;
01005 }
01006 
01007 /* Collect multiple values for mgsnid specifiers */
01008 static int lmd_parse_mgs(struct lustre_mount_data *lmd, char **ptr)
01009 {
01010         lnet_nid_t nid;
01011         char *tail = *ptr;
01012         char *mgsnid;
01013         int   length;
01014         int   oldlen = 0;
01015 
01016         /* Find end of nidlist */
01017         while (class_parse_nid_quiet(tail, &nid, &tail) == 0) {}
01018         length = tail - *ptr;
01019         if (length == 0) {
01020                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x159, "Can't parse NID '%s'\n", *ptr);
01021                 return -EINVAL;
01022         }
01023 
01024         if (lmd->lmd_mgs != NULL)
01025                 oldlen = strlen(lmd->lmd_mgs) + 1;
01026 
01027         OBD_ALLOC(mgsnid, oldlen + length + 1);
01028         if (mgsnid == NULL)
01029                 return -ENOMEM;
01030 
01031         if (lmd->lmd_mgs != NULL) {
01032                 /* Multiple mgsnid= are taken to mean failover locations */
01033                 memcpy(mgsnid, lmd->lmd_mgs, oldlen);
01034                 mgsnid[oldlen - 1] = ':';
01035                 OBD_FREE(lmd->lmd_mgs, oldlen);
01036         }
01037         memcpy(mgsnid + oldlen, *ptr, length);
01038         mgsnid[oldlen + length] = '\0';
01039         lmd->lmd_mgs = mgsnid;
01040         *ptr = tail;
01041 
01042         return 0;
01043 }
01044 
01057 static int lmd_find_comma(char *buf, char **endh)
01058 {
01059         char *c = buf;
01060         int   skip = 0;
01061 
01062         if (buf == NULL)
01063                 return 1;
01064 
01065         while (*c != '\0') {
01066                 if (*c == '[')
01067                         skip++;
01068                 else if (*c == ']')
01069                         skip--;
01070 
01071                 if (*c == ',' && skip == 0) {
01072                         if (endh != NULL)
01073                                 *endh = c;
01074                         return 0;
01075                 }
01076 
01077                 c++;
01078         }
01079 
01080         return 1;
01081 }
01082 
01095 static int lmd_parse_nidlist(char *buf, char **endh)
01096 {
01097         struct list_head nidlist;
01098         char            *endp = buf;
01099         char             tmp;
01100         int              rc = 0;
01101 
01102         if (buf == NULL)
01103                 return 1;
01104         while (*buf == ',' || *buf == ':')
01105                 buf++;
01106         if (*buf == ' ' || *buf == '/' || *buf == '\0')
01107                 return 1;
01108 
01109         if (lmd_find_comma(buf, &endp) != 0)
01110                 endp = buf + strlen(buf);
01111 
01112         tmp = *endp;
01113         *endp = '\0';
01114 
01115         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&nidlist);
01116         if (cfs_parse_nidlist(buf, strlen(buf), &nidlist) <= 0)
01117                 rc = 1;
01118         cfs_free_nidlist(&nidlist);
01119 
01120         *endp = tmp;
01121         if (rc != 0)
01122                 return rc;
01123         if (endh != NULL)
01124                 *endh = endp;
01125         return 0;
01126 }
01127 
01132 static int lmd_parse(char *options, struct lustre_mount_data *lmd)
01133 {
01134         char *s1, *s2, *s3, *devname = NULL;
01135         struct lustre_mount_data *raw = (struct lustre_mount_data *)options;
01136         int rc = 0;
01137         ENTRY;
01138 
01139         LASSERT(lmd);
01140         if (!options) {
01141                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x162, "Missing mount data: check that "
01142                                    "/sbin/mount.lustre is installed.\n");
01143                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01144         }
01145 
01146         /* Options should be a string - try to detect old lmd data */
01147         if ((raw->lmd_magic & 0xffffff00) == (LMD_MAGIC & 0xffffff00)) {
01148                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x163, "You're using an old version of "
01149                                    "/sbin/mount.lustre.  Please install "
01150                                    "version %s\n", LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING);
01151                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01152         }
01153         lmd->lmd_magic = LMD_MAGIC;
01154 
01155         OBD_ALLOC(lmd->lmd_params, LMD_PARAMS_MAXLEN);
01156         if (lmd->lmd_params == NULL)
01157                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01158         lmd->lmd_params[0] = '\0';
01159 
01160         /* Set default flags here */
01161 
01162         s1 = options;
01163         while (*s1) {
01164                 int clear = 0;
01165                 int time_min = OBD_RECOVERY_TIME_MIN;
01166 
01167                 /* Skip whitespace and extra commas */
01168                 while (*s1 == ' ' || *s1 == ',')
01169                         s1++;
01170                 s3 = s1;
01171 
01172                 /* Client options are parsed in ll_options: eg. flock,
01173                    user_xattr, acl */
01174 
01175                 /* Parse non-ldiskfs options here. Rather than modifying
01176                    ldiskfs, we just zero these out here */
01177                 if (strncmp(s1, "abort_recov", 11) == 0) {
01178                         lmd->lmd_flags |= LMD_FLG_ABORT_RECOV;
01179                         clear++;
01180                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "recovery_time_soft=", 19) == 0) {
01181                         lmd->lmd_recovery_time_soft = max_t(int,
01182                                 simple_strtoul(s1 + 19, NULL, 10), time_min);
01183                         clear++;
01184                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "recovery_time_hard=", 19) == 0) {
01185                         lmd->lmd_recovery_time_hard = max_t(int,
01186                                 simple_strtoul(s1 + 19, NULL, 10), time_min);
01187                         clear++;
01188                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "noir", 4) == 0) {
01189                         lmd->lmd_flags |= LMD_FLG_NOIR; /* test purpose only. */
01190                         clear++;
01191                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "nosvc", 5) == 0) {
01192                         lmd->lmd_flags |= LMD_FLG_NOSVC;
01193                         clear++;
01194                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "nomgs", 5) == 0) {
01195                         lmd->lmd_flags |= LMD_FLG_NOMGS;
01196                         clear++;
01197                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "noscrub", 7) == 0) {
01198                         lmd->lmd_flags |= LMD_FLG_NOSCRUB;
01199                         clear++;
01200                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "skip_lfsck", 10) == 0) {
01201                         lmd->lmd_flags |= LMD_FLG_SKIP_LFSCK;
01202                         clear++;
01203                 } else if (strncmp(s1, PARAM_MGSNODE,
01204                                    sizeof(PARAM_MGSNODE) - 1) == 0) {
01205                         s2 = s1 + sizeof(PARAM_MGSNODE) - 1;
01206                         /* Assume the next mount opt is the first
01207                            invalid nid we get to. */
01208                         rc = lmd_parse_mgs(lmd, &s2);
01209                         if (rc)
01210                                 goto invalid;
01211                         s3 = s2;
01212                         clear++;
01213                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "writeconf", 9) == 0) {
01214                         lmd->lmd_flags |= LMD_FLG_WRITECONF;
01215                         clear++;
01216                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "update", 6) == 0) {
01217                         lmd->lmd_flags |= LMD_FLG_UPDATE;
01218                         clear++;
01219                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "virgin", 6) == 0) {
01220                         lmd->lmd_flags |= LMD_FLG_VIRGIN;
01221                         clear++;
01222                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "noprimnode", 10) == 0) {
01223                         lmd->lmd_flags |= LMD_FLG_NO_PRIMNODE;
01224                         clear++;
01225                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "mgssec=", 7) == 0) {
01226                         rc = lmd_parse_mgssec(lmd, s1 + 7);
01227                         if (rc)
01228                                 goto invalid;
01229                         clear++;
01230                 /* ost exclusion list */
01231                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "exclude=", 8) == 0) {
01232                         rc = lmd_make_exclusion(lmd, s1 + 7);
01233                         if (rc)
01234                                 goto invalid;
01235                         clear++;
01236                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "mgs", 3) == 0) {
01237                         /* We are an MGS */
01238                         lmd->lmd_flags |= LMD_FLG_MGS;
01239                         clear++;
01240                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "svname=", 7) == 0) {
01241                         rc = lmd_parse_string(&lmd->lmd_profile, s1 + 7);
01242                         if (rc)
01243                                 goto invalid;
01244                         clear++;
01245                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "param=", 6) == 0) {
01246                         size_t length, params_length;
01247                         char  *tail = s1;
01248                         if (lmd_find_comma(s1 + 6, &tail) != 0)
01249                                 length = strlen(s1);
01250                         else {
01251                                 char *param_str = tail + 1;
01252                                 int   supplementary = 1;
01253                                 while (lmd_parse_nidlist(param_str,
01254                                                          &param_str) == 0) {
01255                                         supplementary = 0;
01256                                 }
01257                                 length = param_str - s1 - supplementary;
01258                         }
01259                         length -= 6;
01260                         params_length = strlen(lmd->lmd_params);
01261                         if (params_length + length + 1 >= LMD_PARAMS_MAXLEN)
01262                                 RETURN(-E2BIG);
01263                         strncat(lmd->lmd_params, s1 + 6, length);
01264                         lmd->lmd_params[params_length + length] = '\0';
01265                         strlcat(lmd->lmd_params, " ", LMD_PARAMS_MAXLEN);
01266                         s3 = s1 + 6 + length;
01267                         clear++;
01268                 } else if (strncmp(s1, "osd=", 4) == 0) {
01269                         rc = lmd_parse_string(&lmd->lmd_osd_type, s1 + 4);
01270                         if (rc)
01271                                 goto invalid;
01272                         clear++;
01273                 }
01274                 /* Linux 2.4 doesn't pass the device, so we stuck it at the
01275                    end of the options. */
01276                 else if (strncmp(s1, "device=", 7) == 0) {
01277                         devname = s1 + 7;
01278                         /* terminate options right before device.  device
01279                            must be the last one. */
01280                         *s1 = '\0';
01281                         break;
01282                 }
01283 
01284                 /* Find next opt */
01285                 s2 = strchr(s3, ',');
01286                 if (s2 == NULL) {
01287                         if (clear)
01288                                 *s1 = '\0';
01289                         break;
01290                 }
01291                 s2++;
01292                 if (clear)
01293                         memmove(s1, s2, strlen(s2) + 1);
01294                 else
01295                         s1 = s2;
01296         }
01297 
01298         if (!devname) {
01299                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x164, "Can't find the device name "
01300                                    "(need mount option 'device=...')\n");
01301                 goto invalid;
01302         }
01303 
01304         s1 = strstr(devname, ":/");
01305         if (s1) {
01306                 ++s1;
01307                 lmd->lmd_flags |= LMD_FLG_CLIENT;
01308                 /* Remove leading /s from fsname */
01309                 while (*++s1 == '/')
01310                         ;
01311                 s2 = s1;
01312                 while (*s2 != '/' && *s2 != '\0')
01313                         s2++;
01314                 /* Freed in lustre_free_lsi */
01315                 OBD_ALLOC(lmd->lmd_profile, s2 - s1 + 8);
01316                 if (!lmd->lmd_profile)
01317                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01318 
01319                 strncat(lmd->lmd_profile, s1, s2 - s1);
01320                 strncat(lmd->lmd_profile, "-client", 7);
01321 
01322                 s1 = s2;
01323                 s2 = s1 + strlen(s1) - 1;
01324                 /* Remove padding /s from fileset */
01325                 while (*s2 == '/')
01326                         s2--;
01327                 if (s2 > s1) {
01328                         OBD_ALLOC(lmd->lmd_fileset, s2 - s1 + 2);
01329                         if (lmd->lmd_fileset == NULL) {
01330                                 OBD_FREE(lmd->lmd_profile,
01331                                         strlen(lmd->lmd_profile) + 1);
01332                                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01333                         }
01334                         strncat(lmd->lmd_fileset, s1, s2 - s1 + 1);
01335                 }
01336         }
01337 
01338         /* Freed in lustre_free_lsi */
01339         OBD_ALLOC(lmd->lmd_dev, strlen(devname) + 1);
01340         if (!lmd->lmd_dev)
01341                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01342         strcpy(lmd->lmd_dev, devname);
01343 
01344         /* Save mount options */
01345         s1 = options + strlen(options) - 1;
01346         while (s1 >= options && (*s1 == ',' || *s1 == ' '))
01347                 *s1-- = 0;
01348         if (*options != 0) {
01349                 /* Freed in lustre_free_lsi */
01350                 OBD_ALLOC(lmd->lmd_opts, strlen(options) + 1);
01351                 if (!lmd->lmd_opts)
01352                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01353                 strcpy(lmd->lmd_opts, options);
01354         }
01355 
01356         lmd_print(lmd);
01357         lmd->lmd_magic = LMD_MAGIC;
01358 
01359         RETURN(rc);
01360 
01361 invalid:
01362         CERROR("Bad mount options %s\n", options);
01363         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01364 }
01365 
01366 struct lustre_mount_data2 {
01367         void *lmd2_data;
01368         struct vfsmount *lmd2_mnt;
01369 };
01370 
01376 static int lustre_fill_super(struct super_block *sb, void *data, int silent)
01377 {
01378         struct lustre_mount_data *lmd;
01379         struct lustre_mount_data2 *lmd2 = data;
01380         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi;
01381         int rc;
01382         ENTRY;
01383 
01384         CDEBUG(D_MOUNT|D_VFSTRACE, "VFS Op: sb %p\n", sb);
01385 
01386         lsi = lustre_init_lsi(sb);
01387         if (!lsi)
01388                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01389         lmd = lsi->lsi_lmd;
01390 
01391         /*
01392          * Disable lockdep during mount, because mount locking patterns are
01393          * `special'.
01394          */
01395         lockdep_off();
01396 
01397         /*
01398          * LU-639: the obd cleanup of last mount may not finish yet, wait here.
01399          */
01400         obd_zombie_barrier();
01401 
01402         /* Figure out the lmd from the mount options */
01403         if (lmd_parse((char *)(lmd2->lmd2_data), lmd)) {
01404                 lustre_put_lsi(sb);
01405                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01406         }
01407 
01408         if (lmd_is_client(lmd)) {
01409                 CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "Mounting client %s\n", lmd->lmd_profile);
01410                 if (client_fill_super == NULL)
01411                         request_module("lustre");
01412                 if (client_fill_super == NULL) {
01413                         LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x165, "Nothing registered for "
01414                                            "client mount! Is the 'lustre' "
01415                                            "module loaded?\n");
01416                         lustre_put_lsi(sb);
01417                         rc = -ENODEV;
01418                 } else {
01419                         rc = lustre_start_mgc(sb);
01420                         if (rc) {
01421                                 lustre_put_lsi(sb);
01422                                 GOTO(out, rc);
01423                         }
01424                         /* Connect and start */
01425                         /* (should always be ll_fill_super) */
01426                         rc = (*client_fill_super)(sb, lmd2->lmd2_mnt);
01427                         /* c_f_s will call lustre_common_put_super on failure */
01428                 }
01429         } else {
01430 #ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
01431                 CDEBUG(D_MOUNT, "Mounting server from %s\n", lmd->lmd_dev);
01432                 rc = server_fill_super(sb);
01433                 /* s_f_s calls lustre_start_mgc after the mount because we need
01434                    the MGS nids which are stored on disk.  Plus, we may
01435                    need to start the MGS first. */
01436                 /* s_f_s will call server_put_super on failure */
01437 #else
01438                 CERROR("This is client-side-only module, "
01439                        "cannot handle server mount.\n");
01440                 rc = -EINVAL;
01441 #endif
01442         }
01443 
01444         /* If error happens in fill_super() call, @lsi will be killed there.
01445          * This is why we do not put it here. */
01446         GOTO(out, rc);
01447 out:
01448         if (rc) {
01449                 CERROR("Unable to mount %s (%d)\n",
01450                        s2lsi(sb) ? lmd->lmd_dev : "", rc);
01451         } else {
01452                 CDEBUG(D_SUPER, "Mount %s complete\n",
01453                        lmd->lmd_dev);
01454         }
01455         lockdep_on();
01456         return rc;
01457 }
01458 
01459 
01460 /* We can't call ll_fill_super by name because it lives in a module that
01461    must be loaded after this one. */
01462 void lustre_register_client_fill_super(int (*cfs)(struct super_block *sb,
01463                                                   struct vfsmount *mnt))
01464 {
01465         client_fill_super = cfs;
01466 }
01467 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_register_client_fill_super);
01468 
01469 void lustre_register_kill_super_cb(void (*cfs)(struct super_block *sb))
01470 {
01471         kill_super_cb = cfs;
01472 }
01473 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lustre_register_kill_super_cb);
01474 
01475 /***************** FS registration ******************/
01476 #ifdef HAVE_FSTYPE_MOUNT
01477 static struct dentry *lustre_mount(struct file_system_type *fs_type, int flags,
01478                                    const char *devname, void *data)
01479 {
01480         struct lustre_mount_data2 lmd2 = { data, NULL };
01481 
01482         return mount_nodev(fs_type, flags, &lmd2, lustre_fill_super);
01483 }
01484 #else
01485 static int lustre_get_sb(struct file_system_type *fs_type, int flags,
01486                          const char *devname, void *data, struct vfsmount *mnt)
01487 {
01488         struct lustre_mount_data2 lmd2 = { data, mnt };
01489 
01490         return get_sb_nodev(fs_type, flags, &lmd2, lustre_fill_super, mnt);
01491 }
01492 #endif
01493 
01494 static void lustre_kill_super(struct super_block *sb)
01495 {
01496         struct lustre_sb_info *lsi = s2lsi(sb);
01497 
01498         if (kill_super_cb && lsi && !IS_SERVER(lsi))
01499                 (*kill_super_cb)(sb);
01500 
01501         kill_anon_super(sb);
01502 }
01503 
01506 static struct file_system_type lustre_fs_type = {
01507         .owner        = THIS_MODULE,
01508         .name         = "lustre",
01509 #ifdef HAVE_FSTYPE_MOUNT
01510         .mount        = lustre_mount,
01511 #else
01512         .get_sb       = lustre_get_sb,
01513 #endif
01514         .kill_sb      = lustre_kill_super,
01515         .fs_flags     = FS_REQUIRES_DEV | FS_HAS_FIEMAP | FS_RENAME_DOES_D_MOVE,
01516 };
01517 MODULE_ALIAS_FS("lustre");
01518 
01519 int lustre_register_fs(void)
01520 {
01521         return register_filesystem(&lustre_fs_type);
01522 }
01523 
01524 int lustre_unregister_fs(void)
01525 {
01526         return unregister_filesystem(&lustre_fs_type);
01527 }
